alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 3:03PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR AREAS NORTH OF IRON SPRINGS UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Spence Creek, Bottleneck Wash, Mint Wash, Skull Valley Wash, Iron Springs Wash and Willow Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Prescott along Williamson Valley Road and Yavapai Campground. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
